channel.title: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days
channel.description: What the title says. Like what the hell? 2 years ago when I launched my first source ever, an allstar-scape base, and I posted it on the server status page, I gained literally 50-60 players within the hour, and that was without posting it on all of the other sites. Now, I've posted my server on 4 different website's server status pages including this one and for the past 2 weeks my server only averages 5-7 players. Why has it become so hard to gain new players? Like what do you have to do to get more players? And it's not like there's hundreds of people logging in then just logging out. I mean barely anyone is ever logging in. What has happened to RSPS?

item.title: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

we should like... ask for the sponsored servers to go bye bye o_O

Read full topic

item.title: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

runefreak10:

What the title says. Like what the hell? 2 years ago when I launched my first source ever, an allstar-scape base, and I posted it on the server status page, I gained literally 50-60 players within the hour, and that was without posting it on all of the other sites. Now, I’ve posted my server on 4 different website’s server status pages including this one and for the past 2 weeks my server only averages 5-7 players. Why has it become so hard to gain new players? Like what do you have to do to get more players? And it’s not like there’s hundreds of people logging in then just logging out. I mean barely anyone is ever logging in. What has happened to RSPS?

most of those RSPS players bought some brains and started to make their own servers ; this reduces the amount of RSPS players in 2 ways…

item.title: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

[quote=“ChaosPkers, post:29, topic:360963”][quote author=John459 link=topic=457257.msg3350936#msg3350936 date=1285304263]
It all got ruined a long time ago when people stopped worrying about quality.
[/quote]quality never really mattered to the players :S if it was fun i’d play it. end of story.

we should like… ask for the sponsored servers to go bye bye o_O[/quote]

It should though, and that’s why well-made servers don’t get any players. Someone who does less work is getting more than someone else who did more work.

item.title: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days
item.dc:creator: @theUnforgiven theUnforgiven
item.description:
@theUnforgiven wrote:

Those were the good days jmood, I remember in 7th grade, roughly 2 years ago, it was heaven running a shitty allstar source. 50-60 players ALL the time. I would only host it during the day and turn it on at night, but the funny thing is as soon as I’d turn it on 10-20 people would log on right away. I was like “Wtf? Its not even on the status page haha”. I miss my old community.

Word.

Read full topic
item.source: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days

item.title: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Moparscapeoriginal, post:25, topic:360963”]This thread is starting to get a bit angry…

My opinion, I would love to see these forums get updated to something a little better like Vbulletin and have a sexy black background. Would be nice as nothing has changed for a LONG time.[/quote]

Why pay for a forum software, when you can just get a free one?

Also I remember back in the day when I had a server, I didn’t even advertise it once and I had 50+ online at almost all the time. Now with the server status pages, you have to either have created a server a year ago and put it up or you need to pay 300+ to gain people.

Read full topic

item.title: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

Its a cycle… Botting is in, Servers are out. Maybe in another 2 or 3 years Jagex will find a way to isolate bots more and people will return to servers. (In which they will gain more protocol knowledge to then again, return to botting)

Read full topic
item.source: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days

item.title: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:21, topic:360963”][quote author=T3arful link=topic=457257.msg3346860#msg3346860 date=1284906569]

Your server is buried in piles of crap.

So spend a lot of money, get to the top of the crap and you will obtain players (and cash).
Gotta spend money to make money.
[/quote]RSPS shouldn’t be there to make money in the first place…[/quote]
If you want to have a server with a lot of players you’re going to need money to support them. I sure as hell wouldn’t pay for a dedicated server and a variety of other things out of my own pocket if I didn’t have to, would you?

Read full topic

item.title: It seems gaining new players is impossible these days
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

If you put time and lots of work into a server people don’t really come, it’s the PVP 100% spawning servers that get players because everyone is too lazy to actually have a little bit of a challenge.

If you want people to come to your server, do something that no one has done in awhile or before. People want new things, if they don’t get em` they bitch.
